oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1947-12-06 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of excerpts from a Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:00-9:30 pm) from December 6, 1947. Featuring Ott Devine (announcer), Louie Buck (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Cowboy Copas, Curly Fox, Texas Ruby, Bradley Kincaid, Pap's Jug Band, Johnnie & Jack and their Tennessee Mountain Boys, and Tommy Jackson. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Curly Fox; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Louie Buck and Roy Acuff talk -- Johnson's Old Grey Mule (Curly Fox) -- Louie Buck introduces Roy Acuff -- Crying Holy Unto My Lord (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Royal Crown Cola Commercial (Louie Buck, Ott Devine) (incomplete) -- [break] -- Sing Tom Kitty ([Unconfirmed]) -- Louie Buck introduces Tommy Jackson -- Arkansas Traveler (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Louie Buck talks -- Theme (Turkey In The Straw, RCC version) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Copas, Cowboy; Fox, Curly; Texas Ruby; Kincaid, Bradley; Wilson, Lonnie; Pap's Jug Band; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Bashful Brother Oswald; Easterday, Jess; Jackson, Tommy; Zinkan, Joe; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Devine, Ott, 1910-1994;
